etymology.description: 商(商) (shāng, "commerce") + 场(場) (chǎng, "open space" or "place") = a place for commerce
etymology.interpretation: A 商场(商場) (shāngchǎng, "shopping mall") is a large open space dedicated to commerce where various shops and businesses are situated. The combination of 商(商) (shāng, "commerce") with 场(場) (chǎng, "open space" or "place") conveys the idea of a designated area for trade and services, aligning with modern commercial practices.
etymology.simplification: Customary simplification by converting 場 to 场

examples.chinese: 她喜欢在商场(她喜歡在商場)，在那里逛街(在那裏逛街)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān zài shāngchǎng, zài nàlǐ guàngjiē.
examples.english: She likes shopping at the mall, strolling around there.

examples.chinese: 我打算去商场(我打算去商場)，看看新款服装(看看新款服裝)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dǎsuàn qù shāngchǎng, kànkan xīnkuǎn fúzhuāng.
examples.english: I plan to go to the mall to check out the new fashion clothes.

examples.chinese: 周末时(周末時)，我们在商场(我們在商場)放松休闲(放鬆休閒)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò shí, wǒmen zài shāngchǎng fàngsōng xiūxián.
examples.english: On weekends, we relax at the shopping mall.
